title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 34 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on 2 Chronicles chapter 34 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 34 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of 2 Chronicles Chapter 34.

questions.question: At what age did Josiah begin to reign in Jerusalem?
questions.correctAnswer: Eight years old
questions.explanation: Josiah was eight years old when he began to reign, as stated in 2 Chronicles 34:1.

questions.question: How long did Josiah reign in Jerusalem?
questions.correctAnswer: Thirty-one years
questions.explanation: Josiah reigned in Jerusalem for one and thirty years (thirty-one years) according to 2 Chronicles 34:1.

questions.question: What kind of actions did Josiah do in the sight of the LORD?
questions.correctAnswer: That which was right
questions.explanation: Josiah did what was right in the sight of the LORD as described in 2 Chronicles 34:2.

questions.question: In which year of Josiah's reign did he begin to seek after God?
questions.correctAnswer: Eighth year
questions.explanation: Josiah began to seek after the God of David in the eighth year of his reign according to 2 Chronicles 34:3.

questions.question: What did Josiah begin to purge from Judah and Jerusalem in the twelfth year of his reign?
options: High places, groves, carved images, and molten images
questions.correctAnswer: High places, groves, carved images, and molten images
questions.explanation: In the twelfth year Josiah began to purge Judah and Jerusalem from these idolatrous things as noted in 2 Chronicles 34:3.

questions.question: True or False: Josiah burned the bones of the priests upon their altars to cleanse Judah and Jerusalem.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 34:5 states Josiah burnt the bones of the priests upon their altars and cleansed Judah and Jerusalem.

questions.question: Who did Josiah send to repair the house of the LORD in the eighteenth year of his reign?
questions.correctAnswer: Shaphan, Maaseiah, and Joah
questions.explanation: Josiah sent Shaphan the son of Azaliah, Maaseiah the governor, and Joah the recorder to repair the house of the LORD as described in 2 Chronicles 34:8.

questions.question: What was found by Hilkiah the priest in the house of the LORD?
options: A book of the law of the LORD
questions.correctAnswer: A book of the law of the LORD
questions.explanation: Hilkiah found a book of the law of the LORD given by Moses, according to 2 Chronicles 34:14.

questions.question: What did Josiah do when he heard the words of the law read by Shaphan?
questions.correctAnswer: He rent his clothes
questions.explanation: Josiah rent his clothes upon hearing the words of the law as recorded in 2 Chronicles 34:19.

questions.question: True or False: Josiah commanded an inquiry of the LORD about the words of the book that was found.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Josiah commanded Hilkiah and others to enquire of the LORD for him concerning the words of the book as seen in 2 Chronicles 34:20-21.

questions.question: To whom did Hilkiah and the king's appointed men go to inquire of the LORD?
questions.correctAnswer: Huldah the prophetess
questions.explanation: They went to Huldah the prophetess as stated in 2 Chronicles 34:22.

questions.question: What did the LORD declare would come upon the place and its inhabitants because they forsook Him?
options: Evil and curses as written in the book
questions.correctAnswer: Evil and curses as written in the book
questions.explanation: The LORD said He would bring evil and all the curses written in the book because the people forsook Him (2 Chronicles 34:24-25).

questions.question: True or False: Because Josiah humbled himself, the LORD promised he would see all the evil brought upon the land.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: The LORD said Josiah would be gathered to his grave in peace and would not see the evil brought upon the land, as per 2 Chronicles 34:27-28.

questions.question: Complete the verse: 'And the king stood in his place, and made a covenant before the LORD, to walk after the LORD, and to keep his ______, and his testimonies, and his statutes, with all his heart, and with all his soul.'
questions.correctAnswer: commandments
questions.explanation: Josiah made a covenant to keep the LORD's commandments, as stated in 2 Chronicles 34:31.

questions.question: What did Josiah do to the abominations in all the countries belonging to Israel?
questions.correctAnswer: Took them away
questions.explanation: Josiah took away all the abominations from the lands belonging to Israel, as told in 2 Chronicles 34:33.

medium.title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 34 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from 2 Chronicles Chapter 34 to real-life situations.

questions.question: How does 2 Chronicles 34:2 teach us about faithfulness and integrity in our walk with God?
options: Walk in the ways of David without turning to the right or left
Follow the advice of friends over God's commands
Change our path whenever it is convenient
questions.correctAnswer: Walk in the ways of David without turning to the right or left
questions.explanation: Josiah did what was right in the sight of the LORD and walked in the ways of David, not turning to the right or left, showing faithfulness and integrity (2 Chronicles 34:2). This teaches us to remain steadfast in obedience and not be swayed by distractions or temptations.

questions.question: A believer is struggling with spiritual complacency. Based on 2 Chronicles 34:3, what biblical truth about seeking God would you share?
options: Begin to seek the Lord early, even in youth
Wait until old age to seek God
Seek only when life is easy
Avoid seeking God to prevent hardship
questions.correctAnswer: Begin to seek the Lord early, even in youth
questions.explanation: Josiah began to seek the God of David his father while he was still young, showing the importance of early devotion and spiritual discipline (2 Chronicles 34:3). This encourages believers to pursue God actively throughout life.

questions.question: What does Josiah's action of breaking down altars and destroying idols in 2 Chronicles 34:4 teach about holiness and obedience?
options: Remove anything that leads to idolatry and sin
questions.correctAnswer: Remove anything that leads to idolatry and sin
questions.explanation: Josiah broke down altars and cut down images that caused idolatry, demonstrating the need to remove sinful influences from our lives to maintain holiness (2 Chronicles 34:4). This teaches obedience and wholehearted commitment to God.

questions.question: How does 2 Chronicles 34:5 illustrate the importance of purifying worship and the community?
options: Burn the bones of priests who served false gods and cleanse the land
Allow all traditions regardless of their origin
Focus only on external worship without purifying the heart
questions.correctAnswer: Burn the bones of priests who served false gods and cleanse the land
questions.explanation: Josiah burned the bones of the false priests on their altars and cleansed Judah and Jerusalem, emphasizing the seriousness of purifying worship and community from false practices (2 Chronicles 34:5). This calls believers to integrity and reverence in worship.

questions.question: A church wants to restore its place of worship faithfully. Based on 2 Chronicles 34:8-11, what principle about stewardship and work ethic can be shared?
options: Faithfully use resources and skilled labor to repair the house of the LORD
Neglect repairs due to lack of interest
Ignore the condition of the worship place
questions.correctAnswer: Faithfully use resources and skilled labor to repair the house of the LORD
questions.explanation: Josiah sent officials to repair the house of the LORD, providing money to skilled workers and overseeing the work faithfully (2 Chronicles 34:8-11). This teaches stewardship, honesty, and diligence in serving God through practical work.

questions.question: How does the discovery of the book of the law in 2 Chronicles 34:14-15 encourage personal devotion and reverence for God's Word?
options: Value and treasure the Word of God when it is found
Ignore the scriptures in daily life
Treat the Bible as a mere historical book
questions.correctAnswer: Value and treasure the Word of God when it is found
questions.explanation: Hilkiah the priest found the book of the law and gave it to Shaphan, demonstrating the importance of valuing God's Word and making it central to our lives (2 Chronicles 34:14-15). This encourages reverence and active engagement with scripture.

questions.question: What does King Josiah’s reaction to hearing the words of the law in 2 Chronicles 34:19 teach about humility and repentance?
options: Rend your clothes and weep when you recognize sin
Ignore sin and continue as before
Deny the truth of the Word
questions.correctAnswer: Rend your clothes and weep when you recognize sin
questions.explanation: Upon hearing the law, Josiah rent his clothes, a sign of humility and repentance (2 Chronicles 34:19). This teaches believers to respond to conviction with humility and sincere repentance.

questions.question: A believer is anxious about God's judgment. Based on 2 Chronicles 34:21-27, what biblical truth about prayer and seeking God would you share?
options: Seek the LORD with a humble heart and He will hear you
Ignore God's warnings and continue sinning
Rely on personal strength without prayer
Avoid confronting sin in your life
questions.correctAnswer: Seek the LORD with a humble heart and He will hear you
questions.explanation: Josiah sent to inquire of the LORD, and because he humbled himself, God heard him and assured peace despite coming judgment (2 Chronicles 34:21-27). This encourages prayerful humility amid challenges.

questions.question: True or False: According to 2 Chronicles 34:30-31, Josiah publicly read the book of the covenant and made a covenant to obey God wholeheartedly.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Josiah read the book of the covenant aloud to the people and made a covenant before the LORD to keep His commandments with all his heart and soul (2 Chronicles 34:30-31), demonstrating public commitment and obedience.

questions.question: How does Josiah’s leadership in renewing the covenant in 2 Chronicles 34:32-33 teach about influence and responsibility in the faith community?
options: Leaders should lead by example to encourage others to serve God
Ignore the spiritual condition of the community
Let others handle spiritual renewal alone
questions.correctAnswer: Leaders should lead by example to encourage others to serve God
questions.explanation: Josiah caused all present to stand to the covenant and led the people to serve the LORD, showing that godly leadership influences and encourages faithful service (2 Chronicles 34:32-33).

questions.question: What biblical principle about spiritual discipline and correction can be drawn from Josiah’s removal of all abominations in 2 Chronicles 34:33?
options: Remove sin and false worship to maintain purity
Allow sinful practices to remain for peace
questions.correctAnswer: Remove sin and false worship to maintain purity
questions.explanation: Josiah removed all abominations and led Israel to serve the LORD faithfully, teaching the need for spiritual discipline and correction to maintain holiness (2 Chronicles 34:33).

questions.question: True or False: According to 2 Chronicles 34:12-13, the Levites were involved in various roles including music, overseeing work, and serving as scribes and porters.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: The Levites were responsible for music, overseeing the work, and serving as scribes and porters, showing the value of diverse service in the faith community (2 Chronicles 34:12-13).

questions.question: A young believer wants to know how to respond when finding God's Word convicting their heart. Based on 2 Chronicles 34:18-19, what biblical response can you encourage?
options: Listen attentively and respond with humility and repentance
questions.correctAnswer: Listen attentively and respond with humility and repentance
questions.explanation: When Josiah heard the words of the law, he rent his clothes in humility and repentance, teaching believers to take God's Word seriously and respond appropriately (2 Chronicles 34:18-19).

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Josiah’s example in 2 Chronicles 34 teaches us to __________ the LORD with all our heart and soul, committing to obey His commands.
questions.correctAnswer: walk after
questions.explanation: Josiah made a covenant to walk after the LORD and keep His commandments with all his heart and soul (2 Chronicles 34:31), teaching wholehearted devotion and obedience.

questions.question: How does the sending of officials to repair the house of the LORD in 2 Chronicles 34:8-10 teach about stewardship and responsibility in serving God?
options: Take initiative and use resources wisely to serve God
Ignore the condition of God’s house
Leave responsibilities to others without involvement
questions.correctAnswer: Take initiative and use resources wisely to serve God
questions.explanation: Josiah sent trusted men to repair the house of the LORD and gave resources to workmen to do the job well, teaching the importance of responsible stewardship and active service (2 Chronicles 34:8-10).

hard.title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 34 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from 2 Chronicles Chapter 34.

questions.question: At what age did Josiah begin to reign as king in Jerusalem?
questions.correctAnswer: 8 years old
questions.explanation: Josiah was eight years old when he began to reign, as stated in 2 Chronicles 34:1.

questions.question: Which king's ways did Josiah follow during his reign?
questions.correctAnswer: David
questions.explanation: Josiah walked in the ways of David his father, doing what was right in the sight of the LORD, according to 2 Chronicles 34:2.

questions.question: In which year of his reign did Josiah begin to seek the God of David?
questions.correctAnswer: 8th year
questions.explanation: Josiah began to seek after the God of David his father in the eighth year of his reign, as noted in 2 Chronicles 34:3.

questions.question: What significant religious action did Josiah undertake in his twelfth year?
options: He began to purge Judah and Jerusalem from idolatry
He built new altars for Baalim
He formed an alliance with Egypt
He wrote a new book of the law
questions.correctAnswer: He began to purge Judah and Jerusalem from idolatry
questions.explanation: In the twelfth year of his reign, Josiah began to purge Judah and Jerusalem from high places, groves, carved images, and molten images (2 Chronicles 34:3).

questions.question: How did Josiah deal with the altars of Baalim and associated idols?
options: He broke them down and cut down the images
He consecrated them for the LORD
questions.correctAnswer: He broke them down and cut down the images
questions.explanation: Josiah broke down the altars of Baalim, cut down the images, and broke the carved and molten images into dust, as described in 2 Chronicles 34:4.

questions.question: What did Josiah do with the bones of the priests who had sacrificed to idols?
options: He burnt the bones upon their altars
He buried them in a holy place
questions.correctAnswer: He burnt the bones upon their altars
questions.explanation: Josiah burnt the bones of the priests upon their altars to cleanse Judah and Jerusalem (2 Chronicles 34:5).

questions.question: Which regions outside Jerusalem did Josiah cleanse from idolatry with mattocks?
questions.correctAnswer: Manasseh, Ephraim, Simeon, and Naphtali
questions.explanation: Josiah cleansed cities in Manasseh, Ephraim, Simeon, and Naphtali with mattocks around them (2 Chronicles 34:6).

questions.question: Who did Josiah send to repair the house of the LORD in the eighteenth year of his reign?
options: Shaphan the son of Azaliah, Maaseiah the governor, and Joah the recorder
The elders of Judah and Jerusalem
questions.correctAnswer: Shaphan the son of Azaliah, Maaseiah the governor, and Joah the recorder
questions.explanation: In the eighteenth year, Josiah sent Shaphan, Maaseiah, and Joah to repair the house of the LORD (2 Chronicles 34:8).

questions.question: What significant discovery did Hilkiah the priest make in the house of the LORD?
options: A book of the law of the LORD given by Moses
questions.correctAnswer: A book of the law of the LORD given by Moses
questions.explanation: Hilkiah found the book of the law given by Moses in the house of the LORD (2 Chronicles 34:14).

questions.question: What was King Josiah's reaction upon hearing the words of the law read by Shaphan?
options: He sent for the prophets immediately
questions.correctAnswer: He rent his clothes
questions.explanation: When Josiah heard the words of the law, he rent his clothes as a sign of mourning and repentance (2 Chronicles 34:19).

questions.question: What was the purpose of sending Hilkiah, Ahikam, Abdon, Shaphan, and Asaiah to Huldah the prophetess?
options: To enquire of the LORD concerning the words of the book found
To deliver a message to the king of Assyria
questions.correctAnswer: To enquire of the LORD concerning the words of the book found
questions.explanation: Josiah commanded them to seek the LORD about the words of the book found because of the great wrath of the LORD (2 Chronicles 34:20-21).

questions.question: What was the prophecy given by Huldah regarding the fate of Jerusalem and its inhabitants?
options: Evil and curses would come upon the place and inhabitants
Peace and prosperity would be restored immediately
The city would be rebuilt by foreign nations
The people would be taken into exile without judgment
questions.correctAnswer: Evil and curses would come upon the place and inhabitants
questions.explanation: Huldah prophesied that evil and all the curses written in the book would be brought upon Jerusalem and its inhabitants because they forsook God (2 Chronicles 34:24-25).

questions.question: How did the LORD respond to Josiah's humility and repentance?
options: Josiah would die in peace and not see the coming evil
Josiah would lose his kingdom immediately
Josiah would be exiled to Babylon
questions.correctAnswer: Josiah would die in peace and not see the coming evil
questions.explanation: Because Josiah humbled himself and wept before God, the LORD promised he would be gathered to his grave in peace and not see the evil to come (2 Chronicles 34:27-28).

questions.question: What covenant did Josiah make before the LORD after hearing the words of the law?
options: To walk after the LORD and keep His commandments with all his heart and soul
To build new altars for Baal
To serve the king of Assyria
questions.correctAnswer: To walk after the LORD and keep His commandments with all his heart and soul
questions.explanation: Josiah made a covenant to follow the LORD, keep His commandments, testimonies, and statutes fully (2 Chronicles 34:31).

questions.question: True or False: Josiah's reforms were limited only to Jerusalem and did not affect the other territories of Israel.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Josiah took away all abominations from all the countries pertaining to Israel and made all present serve the LORD, not just Jerusalem (2 Chronicles 34:33).

theological.title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 34 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from 2 Chronicles Chapter 34 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: At what age did Josiah begin to reign over Judah, and how long did his reign last according to 2 Chronicles 34?
questions.correctAnswer: 8 years old, 31 years
questions.explanation: Josiah began to reign at eight years old and reigned in Jerusalem for 31 years, as stated in 2 Chronicles 34:1. This is consistent with the biblical theme of God using even young leaders for His purposes (1 Samuel 17:33, Jeremiah 1:7).

questions.question: How is Josiah's conduct described in relation to the LORD and the ways of David?
options: He did right and walked steadfastly, not turning right or left
He often strayed but repented quickly
He followed foreign gods alongside the LORD
He ruled with harshness and injustice
questions.correctAnswer: He did right and walked steadfastly, not turning right or left
questions.explanation: Josiah is described as doing what was right in the sight of the LORD and walking in the ways of David without turning aside (2 Chronicles 34:2). This demonstrates the biblical ideal of obedience and steadfastness (Deuteronomy 5:32-33, Joshua 1:7-8).

questions.question: What significant spiritual action did Josiah begin in the twelfth year of his reign?
options: Purging Judah and Jerusalem of high places, groves, and idols
questions.correctAnswer: Purging Judah and Jerusalem of high places, groves, and idols
questions.explanation: In his twelfth year, Josiah began to purge the land of idolatry, removing high places and images (2 Chronicles 34:3). This act reflects God's call for holiness and separation from sin (Exodus 34:12-16, Deuteronomy 12:2-3).

questions.question: What did Josiah do with the altars and carved images of Baal and other idols?
options: Broke them down, cut down images, and made dust of them
Covered them with cloth to hide them
Destroyed only the altars but left images intact
questions.correctAnswer: Broke them down, cut down images, and made dust of them
questions.explanation: Josiah destroyed the altars, cut down images, and made dust of them, scattering it on the graves of idolaters (2 Chronicles 34:4). This symbolizes complete repudiation of idolatry (Exodus 20:3-5, Isaiah 30:22).

questions.question: What was the significance of burning the bones of the priests on their altars during Josiah's reforms?
options: It symbolized cleansing the land from profanation and false worship
It was a common burial custom
It was done to prepare for a festival
questions.correctAnswer: It symbolized cleansing the land from profanation and false worship
questions.explanation: Burning the bones of priests on their altars indicated purging the land of idolatry and desecration (2 Chronicles 34:5). This aligns with God's holiness demands and removal of defilement (Leviticus 20:7-8, 2 Corinthians 6:16).

questions.question: To which other regions did Josiah extend his purging of idolatry besides Judah and Jerusalem?
questions.correctAnswer: Manasseh, Ephraim, Simeon, and Naphtali
questions.explanation: Josiah extended his reforms to these northern tribes, showing his commitment to covenant faithfulness across Israel (2 Chronicles 34:6-7). This reflects God's desire for all Israel to be holy (Deuteronomy 6:6-7, Ezekiel 37:23).

questions.question: What was found by Hilkiah the priest during the temple repairs initiated by Josiah?
options: A book of the law given by Moses
questions.correctAnswer: A book of the law given by Moses
questions.explanation: Hilkiah found the book of the law, which was pivotal in sparking Josiah's covenant renewal (2 Chronicles 34:14-15). This underscores the importance of Scripture in guiding God's people (Deuteronomy 31:24-26, Psalm 119:105).

questions.question: What was Josiah's reaction upon hearing the words of the law read to him?
options: He rent his clothes and humbled himself
He ordered the book to be hidden
questions.correctAnswer: He rent his clothes and humbled himself
questions.explanation: Josiah's tearing of clothes and humility (2 Chronicles 34:19) expresses repentance and godly sorrow (Joel 2:12-13, Luke 18:13). This shows the biblical response to recognizing sin and God's judgment.

questions.question: Who did Josiah send to inquire of the LORD concerning the words of the book found in the temple?
options: Hilkiah the priest, Ahikam, Abdon, Shaphan, and Asaiah
questions.correctAnswer: Hilkiah the priest, Ahikam, Abdon, Shaphan, and Asaiah
questions.explanation: Josiah sent these trusted officials to seek the LORD's guidance (2 Chronicles 34:20-21), demonstrating reliance on priestly and prophetic mediation (Exodus 18:13-26, 1 Samuel 9:9).

questions.question: What was the prophecy given by Huldah the prophetess regarding the fate of the land and Josiah?
options: Evil would come on the land, but Josiah would die in peace
The land would be spared, and Josiah would reign long
Josiah would be deposed and exiled
The temple would be destroyed immediately
questions.correctAnswer: Evil would come on the land, but Josiah would die in peace
questions.explanation: Huldah prophesied judgment for the land due to sin but assured Josiah's peaceful death because of his humility (2 Chronicles 34:24-28). This reflects God's justice and mercy (Deuteronomy 30:15-20, Isaiah 57:15).

questions.question: What covenant did Josiah make before the LORD after hearing the words of the law?
options: To walk after the LORD and keep His commandments with all his heart and soul
To build a new temple for foreign gods
To conquer neighboring nations by force
To ignore the law and follow tradition
questions.correctAnswer: To walk after the LORD and keep His commandments with all his heart and soul
questions.explanation: Josiah made a wholehearted covenant to obey God's law (2 Chronicles 34:31), exemplifying the biblical call to covenant faithfulness (Deuteronomy 6:4-5, Psalm 119:10).

questions.question: How did the people of Jerusalem and Benjamin respond to Josiah's covenant renewal?
options: They stood to the covenant and did according to God's covenant
They rejected the covenant and rebelled
They were indifferent to the covenant
questions.correctAnswer: They stood to the covenant and did according to God's covenant
questions.explanation: The inhabitants stood to the covenant and followed God's ways (2 Chronicles 34:32), illustrating communal repentance and renewal (Nehemiah 8:1-12, Joshua 24:15).

questions.question: What effect did Josiah's reforms have on the presence of idolatry in the lands pertaining to Israel?
options: He removed all abominations and made the people serve the LORD
He only focused on Jerusalem's temple
questions.correctAnswer: He removed all abominations and made the people serve the LORD
questions.explanation: Josiah cleansed the land of idolatry and restored worship of the LORD (2 Chronicles 34:33), fulfilling God's command for holiness (Exodus 23:24-25, Deuteronomy 7:3-6).

questions.question: Which Levites were given oversight and responsibility during the temple repairs under Josiah?
questions.correctAnswer: Jahath, Obadiah, Zechariah, and Meshullam
questions.explanation: These Levites were supervisors in the temple repairs (2 Chronicles 34:12), showing the role of Levites in worship and temple service (Numbers 3:5-10, 1 Chronicles 15:16).

questions.question: What was the purpose of giving money to artificers and builders during Josiah's temple restoration?
options: To buy hewn stone, timber, and repair the houses destroyed by previous kings
To build palaces for the king
questions.correctAnswer: To buy hewn stone, timber, and repair the houses destroyed by previous kings
questions.explanation: Money was allocated to repair the temple and its structures (2 Chronicles 34:11), emphasizing restoration of true worship (Ezra 3:8-13, Nehemiah 2:17-18).
